definition: to stand aloof from worldly affairs
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: I am just a weltfremd, unworldly, young man.
sentences.chinese: 我只是个与世无争的年轻人。

sentences.english: This retiring attitude enhanced his prestige.
sentences.chinese: 他这种与世无争的态度更增加了他的威望。

sentences.english: During the long years, people of the village have lived a peaceful life and stood aloof from worldly strife.
sentences.chinese: 在漫长的岁月里，人们过着与世无争的平静生活。

sentences.english: For a long long time, people there led a peaceful life and stood aloof from worldly affairs.
sentences.chinese: 在漫长的岁月里，人们过着与世无争的平静生活。

sentences.english: They are silent very static, stand aloof from the worldly affairs, to everything all uninterested.
sentences.chinese: 他们沉默好静，与世无争，对任何事情均兴味索然。

sentences.english: All the Talz wanted was to be left alone on their world.
sentences.chinese: 塔尔兹人只是希望在他们的星球过与世无争的生活。

sentences.english: Then began a quiet life of seclusion stand aloof from worldly success.
sentences.chinese: 后来开始隐居过着与世无争的平静生活。

sentences.english: Bound together in some unworldly way, sharing a spirit or so the like.
sentences.chinese: 与世无争地捆绑在一起，分享精神与思想。

definition: quiet and contented/indifferent to fame or gain
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to be content with what one is
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3

definition: to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
